slide.title: Deviating from Normal ...
slide.p: A few things are different in this course, compared to what you might be used to...

slide.title: Flipped Learning
slide.p: Weekly readings will be assigned, starting with the second week, following somewhat of a "flipped" learning model.
You are to read these lessons and answer a D2L survey, by the evening before that week's lecture. This gives me a chance to adjust the lecture, and to address issues important to you.
This is not a fully "flipped" model, which would have the lectures totally online, and which would have face-to-face sessions be seminars only.

slide.title: Flipped LMS
slide.p: Desire2Learn (D2L) is a very comprehensive Learning Management System (LMS).
It is both flexible and inflexible at the same time, and expects content to be re-expressed inside its awkward & clunky confines.

A flipped LMS, on the other hand, lives independently of D2L, and is whatever suits the tech-savvyness of the instructor. These are typically open-source, flat file driven, and stored/collaborated on, using an online repository.

ul.li: Organizer, lessons, tutorials, and lab/assignment writeups all on our course hub.
Material can be viewed as slideshow or webpage, and maybe downloaded as PDF.
Code examples or starter projects all shared as Github repositories, to be forked/downloaded.
Assignments done in teams, on github; readme (with links) is submitted to D2L dropbox
